title: Double Date
description: Michael sparks more anger from Pam when he breaks up with her mom on her birthday after he finds out she's 58, and Dwight unsuccessfully tries to get everyone in the office to owe him a favor.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good morning everybody.  Who would like an authentic New York bagel?  Hmmm?  Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Thank you. [reaches for bagel]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. I got a pumpernickel just for you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow. H & H.  You went all the way to New York City to get us bagels?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, why? Is there a place closer that sells them?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: This is really nice Dwight, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, don't mention it.  You owe me one.  You all owe me one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good morning Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Morning Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hungry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.  I had a fish stick sandwich.  Actually I had two fish stick sandwiches.  My girlfriend didn't want hers.  Because I guess I'm the only aphrodisiac she needs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fish sticks are not an aphrodisiac.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, yeah...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're thinking of deer penis.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It worked.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Regardless.  That was over two hours ago and it is now a scientific fact that you are hungry.  [holds up tray] Bagel?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't mind if I do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: K. I brought cheese too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm taking one for my lady friend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Brain food. Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. [walks out of Michael's office] You owe me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can't a guy just buy some bagels for his friends so they'll owe him a favor which he can use to get someone fired who stole a co-manager position from him anymore?  Geez.  When did everyone get so cynical?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam, would you care for a bagel?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's right.  You're a woman and you need to refuse food the first time.  I'll try again.  Please Pam, reconsider and have a bagel.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have an early lunch.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael's been trying to get Jim and me to hang out ever since he started dating my mom.  I don't know.  I really hoped this thing would just die out, but today he's planning a birthday lunch for my mom and we have to go.  No way out.  No way out.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: These are amazing.  You took all these?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I've always found beauty in uncommon places.  Homeless people.  Graffiti.  Photography lets me capture all that.  Have you ever been photographed before?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh just by like friends.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well here's what I've been doing around here.   It's for a series on exposure in the workplace.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: [walks into the office] Whoohoo! Pammy?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!  [gets up to greet Helene] Hey. Happy birthday.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Thank you. [they hug]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [comes over to hug them both] My girls.  There they are. [Pam walks away]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Birthday lunch.  Birthday lunch- there is no better medicine than birthday lunch.  It'll cure all of your "Gee I don't know if Michael should be dating my mother" and fixes all occurrences of "I don't really see them together".  So, open wide Pam and take a big old spoonful of birthday lunch medicine.  Take with food.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Pam, aren't you going to introduce us to Michael's girlfriend?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think you guys all remember my mom from the wedding.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think everyone has meet Helene.  Shall we?

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Wait a minute.  [looks at the bag in Michael's hand] Is that another birthday present for me cause you already gave me a necklace.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God I love it. [looks at camera and shakes head]

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Tell her how you gave it to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, that wouldn't be-

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: He put it around my neck while I was still asleep this morning.  What a nice way to wake up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. The rest of the story has been censored due to- inappropriosity.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Because of sex?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kevin!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please, Kevin.  You're fired.  [Kevin looks at Jim; Jim shakes his head]  Sorry, sorry.  Work with a bunch of idiots.  Shall we go?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, let's go. [looks at Erin and nods]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, wait. Um- Swartz Lumber is on the phone for you Pam and they say it's urgent.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, you guys.  Just one second.  [picks up phone] Oh my gosh!  Are you serious?  Shipping emergency.  I don't think I can go to lunch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh man, that's crazy.  Right as we were on our way out too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.  Isn't that always how it goes?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Rarely.  If ever.  Let me give it a whirl.  I'll talk to them.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I want to handle it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I feel like its-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's my pleasure. [takes phone from Pam] Hello?  Well that's great. [hangs up phone]  Turns out the paper was there all along.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [sighs] Thank God.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Something's up.  That paper was never supposed to arrive.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: So, Pammy- are you still liking sales?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah- it's exciting.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Well, you know- Michael and I were- talking, and maybe if you put a little more face to face time with your clients you could improve your sales.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam's sales are fine actually.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just want you to succeed Pammy.  You know what, we shouldn't even be talking about business today.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today is about family.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why did I get in the car?  I could of struggled.  I have a whistle in my purse I didn't even blow it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, Dwight.  I have a little surprise for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me guess- you ate the bagel I gave you and loved it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes! [they laugh] And I wanted to return the favor.  I was polishing my loafers and I happened to look over and noticed that your brief case was a little worse for the wear, so a little elbow grease and she's polished right up, back up to her former glory.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Feel it against your cheek.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will.  [Andy rubs the briefcase against Dwight's face]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You give me a gift- Bam!  Thank you note.  You invite me somewhere- Pow! RSVP.  You do me a favor- Wham!  Favor returned.  Do not test my politeness.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me get that door for you-  [runs to open door]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There you go!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you very much.  Now I've got it for you. [holds open door]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh... goodness... thanks.  You know, here's a healthy fitness tip.  If you clench your buttocks together while walking you can really take the pressure off your knees.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Is that right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Observe. [walks towards desk]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Huh. [laughs; follows Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That really works.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, feel free to use that.  Anytime.  Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey- oh, hold on a second.  Do not walk around with your jacket cattywampus.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [straightens Andy's tie]  And that needs to be straight as an arrow.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa-  thank you very much.  [takes off Dwight's glasses and blows on them]  Oh boy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you very much for that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [puts Dwight's glasses back on Dwight's face]  You are very welcome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [pulls out Andy's chair] Have a seat.  Allow me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [pulls out Dwight's chair] Have a seat yourself.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what?  I am going to preemptively change the batteries in your wireless mouse.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Not necessary.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no! [takes mouse and runs away]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You didn't have to do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Andy is complicating things.  But I'm not worried.  This will only up my game.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.  Scott.  Table for four.

quotes.speaker: Hostess
quotes.text: Welcome Scott family.  It'll be just a moment.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I use to love coming here.  The chicken parm is good.  Big part of my childhood.  Oh, maybe Michael will start dating that too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What table should we take?  So many to choose from.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: [sees table decorated with a banner and balloons] Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? All I see are boring old tables with no birthday decorations.  Oh, wait a second!  You mean this one?  Wow!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, you did all this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not about taking credit.  Let's just say we all did it.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Well, thank you.  All of you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it was actually me alone, so- wow look at this place.  Really makes me want to go to Italy some day.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh you'll love it.  You can have my guide books.  I think I'm done with those really long plane rides.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Thank you.  Thanks for lending me the books.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, mom... which birthday are we celebrating this year?

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: [laughs] Sticking with 49.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: 49 again? That's nine years in a row.  This is now our longest family tradition.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's funny.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Well, as long as you're running numbers Pam, then help me out with this one.  Let's see your six months pregnant, but you've only been married for 30 days, so what does that add up to?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, burn.  Burn on you... and a little bit on me, too. [they laugh]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're 54 years old.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: No.  I'm 58.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're 58 years old?

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The only time you should care about a woman's age is if she is too young for you and I am not robbing the cradle.  If anything I am robbing the grave.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mom, have you decided what you want to be called?

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh, well I like Nana, but I also like the classic Grandma.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Please be Grandma.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Definitely Grandma.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I want you to be Grandma.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh, Michael what do you think?  Grandma?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [nods uncomfortably] That-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yay, Grandma!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, would you guys ever do a triathlon, do you think?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Helene?

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh, oh no.  I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am.  I'm definitely going to do it.  I've already got the run and the bike thing down.  Just need to learn how to swim.  Come on, you in?

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh no, I think a triathlon is pretty much something I can rule out.  It just- doesn't interest me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So it's a matter of interest.  Good, okay.  It's not anything you would have ever done.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Hmm... I might have done it when I was younger, but now there's just other things I'd rather be doing, instead of running and jumping and swimming-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well there's no jumping in a triathlon.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're thinking of the broad jump.  Would you try- bungee jumping?

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: No, no... [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Snowboarding?

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: You want to go snowboarding?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I might.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Michael, what are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] Nothing.  Just life- and doing things- before you die. I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I really want to go snowboarding?  No.  But I would like to if I wanted to.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing fanfare] Aye-yi-yi! [lifts covers off trays of food]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's going on in here?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Andy bought lunch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh... no... really?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yep, yep.  Took a page right out of the old Schrute book of niceness.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There is no book.  There's only a survival guide.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You bought breakfast for everyone, so I got lunch for everyone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, well, allow me.  You know what- gosh these tacos are awfully complicated to make.  I will make everyone's tacos! Gra-ga-ga-ga-ga!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So we should get the check?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What about your gift Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, no. No.  It's stupid.  You'd hate it.  I hate it.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: I'm sure I won't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes you will.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He locked himself in his office all morning working on it.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Gimme.  Look at this wrapping paper.  It's got the word love on it in every language.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Aww-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I literally- I put no thought into the wrapping at all.  Might as well of been toilet paper.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: [opens present, reads inscription] A scrapbook of our first memories by Michael Gary Scott.  For my girlfriend Helene on your birthday.  [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's just an arbitrary title.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Ok, there's a penny.  What's that from?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Penny for your thoughts.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: It was from the wishing well at the mall.  You threw it in.  I went back later, waded in and I found it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's amazing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's not amazing... at all.  It's sort of weird that I went and did that.  And now your wish won't come true, so that blows.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: [looking through the book]  A poem!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh that I plagiarized I think.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: [reading]  I can not go to school today said little Peggy Ann McKay...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [whispers to Pam] Shel Silverstein.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Um- I have the measles and the mumps, a gash, a rash and purple bumps. And my teachers really mean- Happy Birthday , I love you Helene.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's really nice Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think it sucks.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: I think it's wonderful, absolutely wonderful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that's because you and I have very different tastes and you like lame things.  It's a generational- sort of gap between us.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: [hugging book] God... it's a scrapbook.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Home run Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You set the bar so high.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was a bunt.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa Dwight.  I'm going to do this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey-  relax I got it covered.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, I insist.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no, no, I insist.   [pushes Andy out of the room and locks the door]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok, Dwight this is ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't worry about it.  You can just owe me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey. Where'd you go?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, just went to the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And then you stopped at the bar on the way back?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I got thirsty.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, weirdo.  Come on.  It's time for cake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Honestly, for a long time I thought I was going to grow old with Holly.  And then I met Helene.  And she is great and she already knows and has done everything  that I have ever wanted to do and can tell me about it.  But, I think I want to do those things myself.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cakes really good.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh, I know.  I love how they use butter cream frosting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Finish your cake, Helene.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Hmmm?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to enjoy that cake because I have something terrible  I need to tell you.  I want you to enjoy your cake before I tell you this terrible, terrible thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Helene I think you're a wonderful person and I- God- I've enjoyed dating you and being your boyfriend so much.  But I have to consider Pam's feelings as a friend and a co-worker I can not in good conscience continue to date you, when I know what this is doing to her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael.  Michael ,it's okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No it's not.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know that it took me a little while to come around and its still a little weird to get used to, but you obviously make my mom very happy.  And that makes me happy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow.  That just- you've really grown.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [covering eyes] Thank you Pam. And I hope you are as gracious during this next part.  Helene, once again you are a wonderful person and you have lived a great life and I envy it.  And I want it someday, but just in the future.  You need somebody who- who understands your references.  Who is Kafkaesque?  I've never- I don't know him.  There's another woman.  And her name is Italy... and skydiving... and bungee jumping.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, so-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I want kids.  And you... unfortunately, have already completed that part of your journey down there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's not my decision.  It's mother nature.  And mother has very strict rules about fer-  [waitress comes over to pour water; long pause] -- tility.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: I, um- I got it.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: I'm 58.  What am I supposed to do now?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, hobbies-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [reaching for something on the top shelf]  Ahh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Stupid things wedged up there.  No one in this office will help me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Alright, move it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What if Dwight dies and I still owe him something?  That is a recipe for a ghost.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh yeah, you're going to owe me big time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's like a little envelope- there you go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Got it. [looks at envelope] To Dwight. Wha-  [opens envelope] Starbucks gift card.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Surprise! [laughs]  It's from everybody.  $15 value.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dammit.  I am no closer to taking Jim down.  What a waste of a day.  I could of grown poisoned mushrooms that would have been this high by now. [bends over and hold hand about 1/2 an inch from the floor]  They're mushrooms.  They don't get that high.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pamela Beesly Halpert-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: May I have a word with you in my office please?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I am working.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, this is a work related matter.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.  Join me please, won't you? [Pam gets up and follows Michael into his office]  I am going to give you a raise.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because of all the good work you've done.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have the lowest sales record of anyone here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's- no, no- it's not about numbers, Pam.  It's about attitude.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have the worst attitude of any person here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you want the raise or what?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I'll take it. [turns to leave]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Pam, Pam- with this raise there are strings attached.  [Pam sighs]  And the string is attached from my heart to your mean attitude.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're bribing me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No!  No- no I am not.  Unless you want me to.  DO you want me to? Cause I will.  I will bribe you.  No.  Your face is saying don't- unless I haven't offered you enough... your face isn't changing.  What is it?  Talk to me face.  Tell me what Pam's brain is thinking.  Come on!  What do you want? What do you want?  Do you want a million dollars?  Do you want to hit me?  Want me to get down on one knee and beg you or-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I want to hit you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I want to hit you.  I'll do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [nervous laughter] Oh- okay , what? I don't- Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.  Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ye- No.  Alright.  I'll take off my jacket and tense my stomach and you can just-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.  I don't think I can hit you in the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, um... we'll do it after work.  In the parking lot.  In front of everyone.  I'm going to hit you as hard as I can.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: See you then.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Quick question.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Are you scared?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Never.  About what?  A little- what are you talking-

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We heard about the punch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What punch?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Pam.  She's going to punch the crap out of your face after work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm pretty sure we said slap.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: No, it's a punch and Pam has that crazy pregnancy strength now.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm getting concerned that you don't seem to understand what's going to happen.  Do you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I- mmm- I'm good.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: alright.  See you there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you and Pam ever get frisky?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Inappropriate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I mean- do you ever wrestle with each other?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All the time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She strong?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She wants it bad Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can you stop this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I don't support her choice to hit you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't either.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But at the same time she looks crazy and I do understand her reasoning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.  I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just need some time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You gotta do something-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just need some time. Just give me some time to make a decision.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How much time do you think you'll need?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No more than a week.  Maybe two weeks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, man!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Pam, can I talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I heard about the hit.  Just- make sure it's off company property, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay, I think we should probably be okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay.  And- the-the power- comes from the back foot.  So its- its all one motion through the- body.  So you stay a little low and there's a twist.  You keep your shoulder down and you kind of throw out the arm.  [demonstrates punch] Pow!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [stands up; gets into stance] Okay wait- it's- you're saying it comes from the foot.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. [punches Toby's hand]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey everybody, he's not in the men's room although the seat was warm so we may have just missed him.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: My money's on Pam.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's not a fight.  What other outcome could there be?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael could win.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How?  He can't hit back.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Why can't you just agree with me sometimes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Am I scared of getting hit in the face?  No.  Everyday weirdo's pay dominatrix's hundreds of dollars for that very privilege.  I'm scared I'm gonna love it.  [claps hands] Let's do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's okay guys... I can handle this.  Everybody can go home.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We're here for the show, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're just a bunch of voyeurs.  Are you eating popcorn?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It has almost no calories.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you ready?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [goes to punch Michael; he flinches] You have to keep your hands down, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. [sighs] Okay.  Alright.  [Pam goes to punch him again] Oh- God!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, you have to put your hands down.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Put your hands in your pockets.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! [braces himself] Pam, Pam- I'm really sorry.  I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you sorry for?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So many things.  I don't know.  It's hard to choose.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How about for dating my mom?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe that-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And dumping her on her birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay- just- don't ever date a member of my family again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  I promise.  [Pam starts to walk away] For the record your mom came on to me. [Pam turns around and slaps him; he gasps]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Holy crap.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Feel better?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.  You were right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [walks with Michael back into the office; Michael is clutching is face and limping] Wait, why are you limping?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's get some raw meat on that face.  I got a chicken in the freezer upstairs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: As I watched Pam's big, strong hand coming towards my face I saw my entire life flash before my eyes.  And guess what?  I have four kids.  And I have a hover-car and a hover-house.  And my wife is a runner and it shows.  And Pam and Jim are my best friends and our kids play together.  And I am happy and I am rich and I never die.  It doesn't sound like much, but its enough for me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahh... [Dwight is holding a frozen chicken to his face]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good, good.  Keep it on there for another five minutes.  Just let the swelling go down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh thank you.  Thanks.  I owe you one Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fire Jim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm cashing in the favor.  Fire him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you talking about-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do it.  Promote me.  Tri-managers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Forget that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can I have an office?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what you can keep your stupid favor.  It's worthless.  And this is my dinner on your face.  I'm keeping it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [pats face] Oh that feels better.
